description: Thirty-one-year-old skeet shooter Gurjoat Siingh Khangura won his maiden national title at the 68th National Shooting Shotgun Championship in Delhi, capping a year of technical changes and setbacks. Calling it just the beginning, Gurjoat sees the gold as a boost toward international selection, Asian Games goals and World Cup medals, stressing discipline, maturity and India’s rising skeet standards.

description: World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen once again found himself in the spotlight, not for his chess moves, but for his angry reaction at the board. The incident happened on Monday during the World Blitz Championship in Doha, after Carlsen lost to India’s Arjun Erigaisi. Chris Bird, the arbiter who was on duty during the game, later explained what happened.

'PKR 11,000 daily allowance': Pay dispute rocks Pakistan hockey
description: Pakistan's senior hockey players are threatening to boycott the upcoming FIH Pro League phase due to a payment dispute. Players allege they received significantly less daily allowance than promised for matches played in Argentina. The Pakistan Hockey Federation cites the Pakistan Sports Board's USD 40 daily allowance policy as the reason for the discrepancy.

'Over-the-top': China sees red over Salman's Galwan trailer; cries distortion of 'facts'
description: Chinese state media, Global Times, has criticized Salman Khan's upcoming film 'Battle of Galwan,' accusing it of distorting facts about the 2020 Galwan Valley clashes. The movie, inspired by the deadly confrontation, features Khan as an Indian Army officer. Despite the film's portrayal, the PLA remains resolute in defending China's territory, according to the publication.

description: India has emerged as the world’s fourth-largest economy, overtaking Japan, and is projected to challenge Germany for the third spot within the next three years. The government remains confident about sustaining growth momentum despite global trade uncertainties.

title: Ban on Starlink: China says Musk's SpaceX national security threat; What China fears
description: Chinese authorities have penalized a foreign vessel for illegally using Starlink, Elon Musk's satellite internet service, within its waters. Banned in China due to national security concerns and lack of operating licenses, Starlink's overseas gateway routing is seen as a threat to strategic interests. China aims to counter this perceived monopoly by developing its own reusable rocket technology.

description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has revised the Class 10 and Class 12 exam schedule for papers earlier fixed on March 3, 2026. Due to administrative reasons, the Class 10 exam will now be held on March 11, while the Class 12 Legal Studies paper has been postponed to April 10. All other exam dates remain unchanged.

description: Union minister Ramdas Athawale expressed his disappointment, calling the RPI(A)'s exclusion from the BJP-Shiv Sena seat-sharing for BMC polls a "betrayal of trust." Despite this, his party will contest 38 seats independently to uphold worker dignity and Ambedkarite community participation in governance, while still supporting the broader Mahayuti alliance on other seats.

Shah had earlier criticized the state government for corruption and fear, promising a revival of Bengal's heritage under BJP rule

description: A shocking incident in Mohali saw Ashok Kumari Goyal, wife of a former Additional Advocate General, found strangled in her home. The family's servant was discovered tied up, with police suspecting a robbery gone awry. Valuables and cash are reported missing, and the accused are still at large. The servant's account has raised suspicions, leading to his detention for questioning.

'Body reduced to skeletal frame': Rtd railway employee, daughter held in captivity; starved by servants
description: A shocking incident in Jhansi saw a retired railway employee and his mentally ill daughter allegedly held captive for five years by their servants. The father died from neglect, while the daughter was found severely malnourished. Relatives discovered the horrific conditions upon visiting after the father's death, leading to a police investigation into alleged property greed.

title: Stephen Curry’s son Canon Curry stuns fans with elite dribbling skills
description: Stephen Curry's son, Canon, showcased remarkable dribbling skills during a Warriors game. The view captivated fans and the clip went viral. Comparisons to 'The Lion King's' Simba emerged, with many predicting a bright future for the young prodigy.  Canon, the youngest of Stephen and Ayesha Curry's four children, is already impressing with his talent.

title: Tripura student murder: Cops refute ‘racial attack’ angle; one of 5 accused from Manipur
description: Uttarakhand CM assures strict punishment for the culprits in the alleged racial murder of Tripura student Anjel Chakma, with a special team dispatched to Nepal to apprehend the absconding accused. While the CM expressed deep sorrow and pledged exemplary punishment, preliminary findings suggest the racial slurs might have been misconstrued.

title: 'Do I get credit?' Trump repeats 8 wars claim; hot mic moment goes viral
description: US President Donald Trump again claimed he resolved the India-Pakistan conflict, stating he mediated an "immediate" ceasefire. However, India maintains the cessation of hostilities was a result of direct military talks, with Prime Minister Modi clarifying no foreign leader requested India to halt its operations.

title: California Wealth Tax: Billionaire Palmer Luckey warns; Govt may snatch your home, salary
description: California's proposed billionaire wealth tax faces fierce opposition from tech leaders like Palmer Luckey, who warns of forced asset sales and financial ruin for entrepreneurs. Critics decry the measure as government overreach, potentially driving away innovation and talent, while proponents argue it addresses wealth inequality and funds essential services.

title: Stefon Diggs scans stands for Cardi B after Patriots’ 42-10 win over Jets
description: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: Tim Dillon questions Erika Kirk’s public appearances after Charlie Kirk tragedy
description: Tim Dillon questioned Erika Kirk’s public appearances after reports about Charlie Kirk, saying people feel confused. On his podcast, he discussed her merch events and her interview with Nicki Minaj at America Fest. Erika Kirk defended her actions, continued leading Turning Point USA, and reassured Minaj during their on-stage conversation.

title: Chinese billionaire’s plan: Gaming tycoon fathered 100 kids; wants US-borns to run video game biz
description: Chinese billionaire Xu Bo reportedly aims to father at least 20 US-born children to inherit his $1.1 billion gaming fortune, bypassing domestic birth restrictions. This mirrors a trend among ultra-wealthy men like Pavel Durov and Elon Musk, who are also expanding their biological legacies through modern means.

title: Happy New Year 2026: Top 100 wishes, quotes to share with your loved ones
description: As December concludes, the world anticipates New Year's Eve, a global celebration of fresh starts and renewed hope. Traditions vary, from Spain's 12 grapes to Denmark's plate-throwing, all emphasizing connection and togetherness. The article offers wishes and quotes to share this spirit of healing and opportunity.
